body_html:
I'm seeing this error as well, unfortunately.

ImportError: Could not find 'cudart64_90.dll'. TensorFlow requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. Download and install CUDA 9.0 from this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit

I'm using tensorflow-gpu-1.8.0, but I've tried tf-nightly-gpu as well with no luck. I have CUDA v9.0, cuDNN 7.1, and the DLL is definitely where it's supposed to be: C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin

My PATH is set correctly, as well (I think!)

Been at this for a while and not sure what else to try :(

UPDATE:

I solved this by removing the %CUDA_HOME% variables from the paths and simply listing C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin, etc. instead.

I also had to install the latest versions of scipy and scikit-learn to remove errors that I got after I made the path change.

Hope this helps someone! :)

body:
I'm seeing this error as well, unfortunately. 

```
ImportError: Could not find 'cudart64_90.dll'. TensorFlow requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. Download and install CUDA 9.0 from this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit
```

I'm using `tensorflow-gpu-1.8.0`, but I've tried `tf-nightly-gpu` as well with no luck. I have CUDA v9.0, cuDNN 7.1, and the DLL is definitely where it's supposed to be: `C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin`

My PATH is set correctly, as well (I think!)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2983780/40287407-fe8a4fe8-5c61-11e8-8725-57b8e4f12a94.png)

Been at this for a while and not sure what else to try :(

UPDATE:

I solved this by removing the %CUDA_HOME% variables from the paths and simply listing `C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin`, etc. instead.

I also had to install the latest versions of `scipy` and `scikit-learn` to remove errors that I got after I made the path change.

Hope this helps someone! :)
